item.title: Cairo Games Vol 2: Writeup
item.description: Here are my solutions to the second edition of the Cairo Games. Nu (Easy) Pakhet (Easy) Seth (Medium) Montu (Medium) Amun (Hard) Nu This problem was pretty straightforward. We have to find to integers x,y<2^128 such that x*y=17 in the prime field used by Cairo. We can easily get such a pair as follows: from sympy import divisors P = 2**251 + 17 * 2**192 + 1 BOUND = 2**128 target = P + 17 for d in divisors(target): n = target // d if n < BOUND and d < BOUND: break ids.
